TopicTitle: Cannot recover any vessels even after landing them.

Articles.Content:
Hello, I have just gotten into KSP as of 0.21.1 and I just made my first mission to the moon in career mode, while landing I ran out of fuel (and my engine blew up) so I was stranded on the mun. I put down my flag and took samples etc, then I got back into my ship and went to the tracking station to recover the ship (because obviously after my engine blew up and i ran out of fuel I cant fly back to kerbin) and no matter what I did the recover button for the ship remained grayed out. I haven't found any other threads with this issue, so am I just missing something or is this a bug?

Software running

Google Chrome

Steam

Kerbal Space Program 0.22

OS:

Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit

Specs:

Intel i5 CPU Quad-Core

GTX660

1TB HDD

8GB DDR3 RAM

(for full list (the few I modified are on this list) it is a Gateway DX4860-UR33P)

Edited October 20, 2013 by Toro
You can only recover ships on Kerbin. You can abort the mission in the tracking station but that will just blow up everything.
Yeah, "recovery" here refers to collecting a ship that has returned to Kerbin (like with aircraft carriers 'n stuff), not to recover a stranded ship.
